definition: senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
to revere as sole orthodoxy/to hold supremacy (of a religion, ideology, cultural norm, social group etc)/to be dominant
respect the old and cherish the young

sentences.english: The company emphasizes humanist, Customer-friendliness and first service forever.
sentences.chinese: 公司强调以人为本，以客为尊，服务永远第一。

sentences.english: Our Father, Jesus, Hallowed be your name.
sentences.chinese: 我们的父，耶稣，愿人都尊你的名为圣。

sentences.english: Everyone respects him as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都尊他为艺术家。

sentences.english: China worships him almost as a saint.
Hao Sheng adhere to people-oriented, customer-focused service culture.
sentences.chinese: 昊盛公司坚持以人为本，以客为尊的服务精神。

sentences.english: His riches were the possession of all within the four seas.
sentences.chinese: 尊为天子，富有四海之内。

sentences.english: This book is now only statue in Japan by the Court for possession of a residual copy library.
sentences.chinese: 此书在日本现在只有尊经阁文库藏的一个残抄本。

sentences.english: I mean the copper Buddha you wanted.
sentences.chinese: 我是指妳想要的那尊铜制佛像。

sentences.english: The modern sculpture outside the new library is the talk of the town.
sentences.chinese: 新图书馆外面的那尊现代雕塑成了街谈巷议的话题。

sentences.english: Looking at those majestic and lofty figures of Buddha, could one ever tell how Buddhism in Dunhuang is influenced by alien arts?
sentences.chinese: 一尊尊美丽庄重的佛像，有哪些域外艺术的影响？

sentences.english: He stretched forth his hand to make a libation, and offered of the blood of the grape.
sentences.chinese: 就伸手放在尊祭的爵上，然后取爵，尊祭葡萄酒。

sentences.english: Whatever expects you as a king, just because of your father is a king.
sentences.chinese: 有谁只因你父的缘故就尊你为王。

sentences.english: In array to don't repulsion, and that?You to he is which the kind like.
sentences.chinese: 为不讨厌，那魔尊呢？你对他是哪种喜欢。

sentences.english: Han Qing Dynasty as the first ancestor of the Yellow Emperor statue is part of the reformists who.

sentences.english: What do you think of the big statue in Columbus Circle?

definition: to consecrate/to enshrine and worship/an offering (to one's ancestors)/a sacrifice (to a God)
the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
abbr. for 阿羅漢|阿罗汉[a1 luo2 han4]
ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
Shengzu, temple name of the second Qing emperor, known as the Kangxi Emperor (1654-1722)/cf. 康熙[Kang1 xi1]
to keep the law/to protect Buddha's teachings/protector of Buddhist law (i.e. temple donor)
